header.title: TimeLapse
header.caption: Know yourself better through auto time tracking.

article.content: We don’t have a precise sense of how we spend our time in a day. Reviewing time-spending is the key to develop self awareness, and give us insights related to productivity, health, distraction and work-life balance. But time-logging required extreme patience and perseverance, which is why so many people have tried logging their time and quited.
TimeLapse is a side project of mine, which brings the concept using one’s personal digital devices to map out the entire daily routine of people, and get inspiring review.

When I first got my hands on a smart watch, I was fascinated by the interesting features: getting notifications on your wrist, unlocking your laptop, tracking your heart rate. But all of these just doesn't add up. They're not formulating a whole idea of the product.

After I discuss it with my friends, I realized that we didn't know what exactly would be different if you have a smart watch. It seems that a smart watch would just be a alternative device. But one thing alerts me:
The one core feature of smart watch, which is the same for other watches, is reading time.

Are we getting the full potential of a smart watch in “reading time” ? From this point of view, I reviewed the most used apps on my smart watch, and realized that I was already using it to logged and planned my schedule. With all these data, I was able to map out my daily rountine, and get the overview of past, present and future.

col1.content: When you talk about time-counting method, you can’t miss the biography of the Russian Scientist Alexander Alexandrovich Lyubishchev, who had invented and praticed time-counting with just paper and pencil for 56 years!

Lyubishvhev could not achieved what he had without his time management system. He also showed us what would happend if a person have a clear understanding of his time-spending for a long period of time.

article.content: I tried to apply Lyubishchev’s time-counting method, and created serval timeline of daily routine for me and some of my friends. It was clear to get a overview of different people’s behaviour and listen to themselfs explaining what they’ve done today. To record all the detail, I had to combine both auto-tracking softwares and manul note-taking.
